name: places/ChIJG3svfMJYwokR4LlUYfAMHvk
formattedAddress: 343 E 66th St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 343 E 66th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text: DO NOT USE. Absolutely awful experience using Capri Laundry for several reasons. Waited over 3 months to receive a refund on service. When they finally sent the refund they go "Can we drop this now?" as if they weren't at fault. They have stained multiple articles of our clothing. They are extremely rude, told us our laundry can't be over 30 lbs or we will be charged extra when it was no where close to that weight. Final straw was they didn't return my towels and claim they did (never got them back), extremely careless and irresponsible customer service. Can't emphasize enough how disappointed I am in their service. Will be looking elsewhere.

Can't emphasize enough how disappointed I am in their service. Will be looking elsewhere.

originalText.text:
So this is a weird review.
They have an EXCELLENT service - my clothes came back clean every time, convenient pickup, same day dropoff, all communication over text, decent enough rates.

Yesterday after I got my laundry dropped off they said they were adding a 20 dollar charge because it was over their 30 pound weight limit.

But I, for the first time in my life, had thought ahead of this moment. They had let me know beforehand to keep it at 30lbs (even though they said no big deal over the phone if its over?) so i bought myself a bag weight off of amazon.

The weight is trusty and accurate.

So everytime i sent my laundry off, I’d weigh it beforehand. Almost always, I’d be at 28 or 29 pounds.

This recent time, after receiving this text that I was getting an additional charge, I thought no way. So when the laundry returned, I double checked the weight: 29.5 pounds. The exact weight it was before i sent it off.

They got super mad at me over text for questioning the weight and then decided to cancel my service. They don’t seem scammy or like theyd overcharge but the weight was certainly 29.5, which is even more odd because they told me they weighed it at 36lbs.

Anyways, they cancelled my service and were rude about it as opposed to considering they could have made a mistake. Which is something I think they do often, considering I had sent them text evidence of a few other times they had things off. Off to a new laundry service! Anyone have any recommendations?

Which is something I think they do often, considering I had sent them text evidence of a few other times they had things off. Off to a new laundry service! Anyone have any recommendations?

originalText.text: Do not use this dry cleaners. I just received my sweater 3 weeks after drop-off and it was completely stained in red (it is blue and white). Capri refused to compensate me for any of the $300 cost of the sweater and told me to "use a different laundry service if I am unhappy with them". Robbery.

text.text: Do not use this dry cleaners. I just received my sweater 3 weeks after drop-off and it was completely stained in red (it is blue and white). Capri refused to compensate me for any of the $300 cost of the sweater and told me to "use a different laundry service if I am unhappy with them". Robbery.

originalText.text:
Left many stains on my clothes that weren’t there pre wash/dry. This was a recurring issue and they tried to blame me and only could say they were “not sure why”. They need to clean their washers and dryers, don’t trust them if you want clean clothes.

****this is NOT fake and is a legitimate review from myself, a previous customer, maybe Capri should take responsibility and not lie about “fake” comments**

originalText.text: Not happy with this service. In the first load I left with them, I ended up getting back a pair of shorts that weren’t mine, which was not a great first impression. They also didn’t apologize for the inconvenience of me having to go back to drop off the shorts. I had asked if they could separate the whites and colors, and the owner said it would cost extra. This made me think it was fine to request, but the next time I asked for the whites to be done separately, they left my text message on read. This made me nervous so I went in person to ask, and the owner was very dismissive, saying “we’ll take care of it” when I asked if I needed to ask every time. The next time I asked again and he said it’s too expensive to do multiple loads, even though I was willing to pay the extra cost. I appreciate that they agreed to give me a refund for the remainder of the month when I said I would do my laundry elsewhere. However, it took over a week to get the payment as I had to follow up multiple times. The on-demand pick-up and drop-off is convenient, but not worth it when I can’t trust that they’re taking care of my clothes.
